tp:treatment-sec.p:
This species was transferred to
Miridiba
, and a type specimen (MFNB) was indicated as holotype ( Coca-Abia 2008 ). Moser (1913a) did not indicate how many specimens he studied, so the indication as holotype by Coca-Abia (2008) was not valid (Art. 73.1 ICZN) (the specimen labelled as holotype was lost on the way back to MFNB). One syntype has been found in Natural History Museum of London (BMNH), which is designated as lectotype herein. The external morphology and male genitalia indicate that this species belongs to morphotype I “
Trichophora
”.
